verses.verse: And<WG2532> straightway<WG2112> in<WG1909> the morning<WG4404> the chief priests<WG749> held<WG4160> a consultation<WG4824> with<WG3326> the elders<WG4245> and<WG2532> scribes<WG1122> and<WG2532> the whole<WG3650> council<WG4892>, and bound<WG1210> Jesus<WG2424>, and carried him away<WG667>, and<WG2532> delivered<WG3860> him to Pilate<WG4091>.

And<WG2532> Pilate<WG4091> asked<WG1905> him<WG846>, Art<WG1488> thou<WG4771> the King<WG935> of the Jews<WG2453>? And<WG1161> he answering<WG611> said<WG2036> unto him<WG846>, Thou<WG4771> sayest<WG3004> it.
And<WG2532> the chief priests<WG749> accused<WG2723> him<WG846> of many things<WG4183>: but<WG1161> he<WG846> answered<WG611> nothing<WG3762>.

And<WG1161> Pilate<WG4091> asked<WG1905> him<WG846> again<WG3825>, saying<WG3004>, Answerest thou<WG611> nothing<WG3756> <WG3762>? behold<WG2396> how many things<WG4214> they witness<WG2649> against thee<WG4675>.
But<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> yet<WG3765> answered<WG611> nothing<WG3762>; so<WG5620> that Pilate<WG4091> marvelled<WG2296>.
Now<WG1161> at<WG2596> that feast<WG1859> he released<WG630> unto them<WG846> one<WG1520> prisoner<WG1198>, whomsoever<WG3746> they desired<WG154>.

And<WG1161> there was<WG2258> one named<WG3004> Barabbas<WG912>, which lay bound<WG1210> with<WG3326> them that had made insurrection with him<WG4955>, who<WG3748> had committed<WG4160> murder<WG5408> in<WG1722> the insurrection<WG4714>.
And<WG2532> the multitude<WG3793> crying aloud<WG310> began<WG756> to desire<WG154> him to do as<WG2531> he had ever<WG104> done<WG4160> unto them<WG846>.
But<WG1161> Pilate<WG4091> answered<WG611> them<WG846>, saying<WG3004>, Will ye<WG2309> that I release<WG630> unto you<WG5213> the King<WG935> of the Jews<WG2453>?
For<WG1063> he knew<WG1097> that<WG3754> the chief priests<WG749> had delivered<WG3860> him<WG846> for<WG1223> envy<WG5355>.
But<WG1161> the chief priests<WG749> moved<WG383> the people<WG3793>, that<WG2443> he should rather<WG3123> release<WG630> Barabbas<WG912> unto them<WG846>.

And<WG1161> Pilate<WG4091> answered<WG611> and said<WG2036> again<WG3825> unto them<WG846>, What<WG5101> will ye<WG2309> then<WG3767> that I shall do<WG4160> unto him whom<WG3739> ye call<WG3004> the King<WG935> of the Jews<WG2453>?
And<WG1161> they cried out<WG2896> again<WG3825>, Crucify<WG4717> him<WG846>.

Then<WG1161> Pilate<WG4091> said<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Why<WG1063>, what<WG5101> evil<WG2556> hath he done<WG4160>? And<WG1161> they cried out<WG2896> the more exceedingly<WG4056>, Crucify<WG4717> him<WG846>.

And<WG1161> so Pilate<WG4091>, willing<WG1014> to content<WG2425> <WG4160> the people<WG3793>, released<WG630> Barabbas<WG912> unto them<WG846>, and<WG2532> delivered<WG3860> Jesus<WG2424>, when he had scourged<WG5417> him, to<WG2443> be crucified<WG4717>.

And<WG1161> the soldiers<WG4757> led<WG520> him<WG846> away<WG520> into<WG2080> the hall<WG833>, called<WG3603> Praetorium<WG4232>; and<WG2532> they call together<WG4779> the whole<WG3650> band<WG4686>. Praetorium: or, the palace, or, hall of audience
And<WG2532> they clothed<WG1746> him<WG846> with purple<WG4209>, and<WG2532> platted<WG4120> a crown<WG4735> of thorns<WG174>, and put it about<WG4060> his<WG846> head,
And<WG2532> began<WG756> to salute<WG782> him<WG846>, Hail<WG5463>, King<WG935> of the Jews<WG2453>!

And<WG2532> they smote<WG5180> him<WG846> on the head<WG2776> with a reed<WG2563>, and<WG2532> did spit<WG1716> upon him<WG846>, and<WG2532> bowing<WG5087> their knees<WG1119> worshipped<WG4352> him<WG846>.

And<WG2532> when<WG3753> they had mocked<WG1702> him<WG846>, they took off<WG1562> the purple<WG4209> from him<WG846>, and<WG2532> put<WG1746> his own<WG2398> clothes<WG2440> on<WG1746> him<WG846>, and<WG2532> led<WG1806> him<WG846> out<WG1806> to<WG2443> crucify<WG4717> him<WG846>.

And<WG2532> they compel<WG29> one<WG5100> Simon<WG4613> a Cyrenian<WG2956>, who passed by<WG3855>, coming<WG2064> out of<WG575> the country<WG68>, the father<WG3962> of Alexander<WG223> and<WG2532> Rufus<WG4504>, to<WG2443> bear<WG142> his<WG846> cross<WG4716>.
And<WG2532> they bring<WG5342> him<WG846> unto<WG1909> the place<WG5117> Golgotha<WG1115>, which<WG3739> is<WG2076>, being interpreted<WG3177>, The place<WG5117> of a skull<WG2898>.
And<WG2532> they gave<WG1325> him<WG846> to drink<WG4095> wine<WG3631> mingled with myrrh<WG4669>: but<WG1161> he received<WG2983> it not<WG3756>.

And<WG2532> when they had crucified<WG4717> him<WG846>, they parted<WG1266> his<WG846> garments<WG2440>, casting<WG906> lots<WG2819> upon<WG1909> them<WG846>, what<WG5101> every man<WG5101> should take<WG142>.
And<WG1161> it was<WG2258> the third<WG5154> hour<WG5610>, and<WG2532> they crucified<WG4717> him<WG846>.
And<WG2532> the superscription<WG1923> of his<WG846> accusation<WG156> was<WG2258> written over<WG1924>, THE KING<WG935> OF THE JEWS<WG2453>.

And<WG2532> with<WG4862> him<WG846> they crucify<WG4717> two<WG1417> thieves<WG3027>; the one<WG1520> on<WG1537> his right hand<WG1188>, and<WG2532> the other<WG1520> on<WG1537> his<WG846> left<WG2176>.
And<WG2532> the scripture<WG1124> was fulfilled<WG4137>, which<WG3588> saith<WG3004>, And<WG2532> he was numbered<WG3049> with<WG3326> the transgressors<WG459>.

And<WG2532> they that passed by<WG3899> railed<WG987> on him<WG846>, wagging<WG2795> their<WG846> heads<WG2776>, and<WG2532> saying<WG3004>, Ah<WG3758>, thou that destroyest<WG2647> the temple<WG3485>, and<WG2532> buildest<WG3618> it in<WG1722> three<WG5140> days<WG2250>,
Save<WG4982> thyself<WG4572>, and<WG2532> come down<WG2597> from<WG575> the cross<WG4716>.

Likewise<WG1161> <WG3668> also<WG2532> the chief priests<WG749> mocking<WG1702> said<WG3004> among<WG4314> themselves<WG240> with<WG3326> the scribes<WG1122>, He saved<WG4982> others<WG243>; himself<WG1438> he cannot<WG3756> <WG1410> save<WG4982>.

Let<WG2597> Christ<WG5547> the King<WG935> of Israel<WG2474> descend<WG2597> now<WG3568> from<WG575> the cross<WG4716>, that<WG2443> we may see<WG1492> and<WG2532> believe<WG4100>. And<WG2532> they that were crucified<WG4957> with him<WG846> reviled<WG3679> him<WG846>.
And<WG1161> when<WG1096> the sixth<WG1623> hour<WG5610> was come<WG1096>, there was<WG1096> darkness<WG4655> over<WG1909> the whole<WG3650> land<WG1093> until<WG2193> the ninth<WG1766> hour<WG5610>.

And<WG2532> at the ninth<WG1766> hour<WG5610> Jesus<WG2424> cried<WG994> with a loud<WG3173> voice<WG5456>, saying<WG3004>, Eloi<WG1682>, Eloi<WG1682>, lama<WG2982> sabachthani<WG4518>? which<WG3739> is<WG2076>, being interpreted<WG3177>, My<WG3450> God<WG2316>, my<WG3450> God<WG2316>, why<WG5101> hast<WG1519> thou forsaken<WG1459> me<WG3165>?
And<WG2532> some of them<WG5100> that stood by<WG3936>, when they heard<WG191> it, said<WG3004>, Behold<WG2400>, he calleth<WG5455> Elias<WG2243>.

And<WG1161> one<WG1520> ran<WG5143> and<WG2532> filled<WG1072> a spunge<WG4699> full<WG1072> of vinegar<WG3690>, and<WG5037> put it on<WG4060> a reed<WG2563>, and gave<WG4222> him<WG846> to drink<WG4222>, saying<WG3004>, Let alone<WG863>; let us see<WG1492> whether<WG1487> Elias<WG2243> will come<WG2064> to take<WG2507> him<WG846> down<WG2507>.
And<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> cried<WG863> with a loud<WG3173> voice<WG5456>, and gave up the ghost<WG1606>.
And<WG2532> the veil<WG2665> of the temple<WG3485> was rent<WG4977> in<WG1519> twain<WG1417> from<WG575> the top<WG509> to<WG2193> the bottom<WG2736>.

And<WG1161> when the centurion<WG2760>, which<WG3588> stood<WG3936> over<WG1537> against<WG1727> him<WG846>, saw<WG1492> that<WG3754> he so<WG3779> cried out<WG2896>, and gave up the ghost<WG1606>, he said<WG2036>, Truly<WG230> this<WG3778> man<WG444> was<WG2258> the Son<WG5207> of God<WG2316>.

There<WG1161> were<WG2258> also<WG2532> women<WG1135> looking<WG2334> on afar<WG3113> off<WG575>: among<WG2532> <WG1722> whom<WG3739> was<WG2258> Mary<WG3137> Magdalene<WG3094>, and<WG2532> Mary<WG3137> the mother<WG3384> of James<WG2385> the less<WG3398> and<WG2532> of Joses<WG2500>, and<WG2532> Salome<WG4539>;

(Who<WG3739> also<WG2532>, when<WG3753> he was<WG2258> in<WG1722> Galilee<WG1056>, followed<WG190> him<WG846>, and<WG2532> ministered<WG1247> unto him<WG846>;) and<WG2532> many<WG4183> other<WG243> women which<WG3588> came up<WG4872> with him<WG846> unto<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2414>.
And<WG2532> now<WG2235> when the even<WG3798> was come<WG1096>, because<WG1893> it was<WG2258> the preparation<WG3904>, that<WG3603> is<WG2076>, the day before the sabbath<WG4315>,

Joseph<WG2501> of<WG575> Arimathaea<WG707>, an honourable<WG2158> counsellor<WG1010>, which<WG3739> also<WG2532> <WG846> waited<WG4327> for<WG2258> the kingdom<WG932> of God<WG2316>, came<WG2064>, and went in<WG1525> boldly<WG5111> unto<WG4314> Pilate<WG4091>, and<WG2532> craved<WG154> the body<WG4983> of Jesus<WG2424>.

And<WG1161> Pilate<WG4091> marvelled<WG2296> if<WG1487> he were<WG2348> already<WG2235> dead<WG2348>: and<WG2532> calling<WG4341> unto him the centurion<WG2760>, he asked<WG1905> him<WG846> whether<WG1487> he had been<WG599> any while<WG3819> dead<WG599>.
And<WG2532> when he knew<WG1097> it of<WG575> the centurion<WG2760>, he gave<WG1433> the body<WG4983> to Joseph<WG2501>.

And<WG2532> he bought<WG59> fine linen<WG4616>, and<WG2532> took him down<WG2507>, and wrapped<WG1750> him<WG846> in the linen<WG4616>, and<WG2532> laid<WG2698> him<WG846> in<WG1722> a sepulchre<WG3419> which<WG3739> was<WG2258> hewn<WG2998> out of<WG1537> a rock<WG4073>, and<WG2532> rolled<WG4351> a stone<WG3037> unto<WG1909> the door<WG2374> of the sepulchre<WG3419>.
And<WG1161> Mary<WG3137> Magdalene<WG3094> and<WG2532> Mary<WG3137> the mother of Joses<WG2500> beheld<WG2334> where<WG4226> he was laid<WG5087>.
